q: Nearly three decades later, "the Donald Rumsfeld problem" came to the Pentagon with orders from George H. W. Bush to shake the place up. "Change is hard for people," Donald Rumsfeld said. Change is hard. But did you make it harder than it had to be by alienating people? asked David Martin . "If you don't want to change and someone above you wants to, it's not fun, replied the ex-Secretary of Defense. Donald Rumsfeld 's Life in Pictures The former

Initially Larry Page and Sergey Brin were pretty young when Google started, so maybe they weren't prepared at that point to run the day-to-day operations of Google. "But at this point they've been involved for several years now, and are in a better position to really run the company as opposed to just being in the founder role. He added, "managing the business has become more complicated," and Google wanted to speed up decision making, so Larry Page got the nod. But in this week's Arts& Leisure section, Jon Caramanica argues that the Aerosmith frontman's wacky charisma has ably replaced Mr. Simon Cowell 's caustic derision as the show's signature quality. Mr. Steven Tyler , who will turn 63 next month, has done much of the heavy lifting for` Idol' this season, Mr. Caramanica writes, "helping keep the show within striking distance of last season's ratings and ensuring that even though certain things have been lost in transition, the show still has a steady center."
